content: pony crochet pattern by jana whitley includes instructions inspired by my little pony characters pinkie pie rarity applejack and rainbow dash finished size 6 inches 15 cm tall materials and tools yarn dk or sport weight i used stylecraft special dk acrylic hobby lobby i love this yarn sport weight baby bee sweet delight acrylic/polyamide and lion brand bonbons stuffing i used mountain mist fiberloft polyester fiberfill d/3 25 mm hook i used clover soft touch hooks 6 mm black plastic eyes with safety backing i used darice brand yarn needle i used clover chibi bent tip needles scissors large-headed pins stitch marker notes all parts in this pattern are worked with a d 3/3 25 mm hook most of the doll s parts are made by stitching continuous spiral rounds at the end of each round do not join rounds with a slip_stitch instead mark the end of the pattern round with a stitch marker such as a piece of contrasting yarn or safety pin in the last stitch of the round when you complete a round count the stitches to make sure it matches the pattern then move the stitch marker up to the loop/stitch on your hook when you are counting stitches in a row do not include the loop that is on your hook the last stitch of the current round should end just to the right of the last stitch of the previous round always insert your crochet hook under both loops front and back of the previous round except when instructed otherwise or when using invisible decrease i recommend crocheting all parts before sewing together pin parts in place before sewing to make sure you like how it looks if the pony is for a young child under 3 years do not use plastic eyes as they are a choking hazard instead embroider eyes with black floss for helpful tutorials on basic amigurumi methods such as switching colors fastening off sewing pieces together narrow tubes magic loop or invisible decrease see the excellent planetjune com crochet website if you are a beginning crocheter i recommend making the pony patterns with worsted weight/4/medium acrylic yarn such at red heart super saver acrylic and an e/3 5mm hook rather than dk/3/medium weight yarn and d/ 3 25mm hook the bigger size hook and yarn will be easier to work with with the worsted weight yarn your finished pony will be about 1 5 to 2 inches taller than the pattern s given height pony crochet pattern janageek on ravelry com
